transcript.text: hello YouTube it is Sunday evening july
the 13th 2008 um I wanted to talk about
some I don't know I get the sense that
there's a lot of people i was reading
some some posts on the ron paul forums
and i've just seen some other people on
youtube and things and there's seems
like there's this attitude amongst a lot
of ron paul supporters that are
basically saying that you know the
presidential election doesn't really
matter anymore and we need to be the in
this for the long haul and you know we
need to look at long-term goals and
things like that which is all fine and
good but they seem to think that the
convention the Republican National
Convention that's going to happen in st.
Paul in September is a lost cause and
that there is absolutely no chance that
the convention will become a brokered
convention that McCain will not get the
nomination at Ron Paul will they saw a
couple posts on the Ron Paul forms today
that said that that's a pipe dream and
there's no chance and I just I really
strongly disagree with that I mean maybe
I'm just naive and I don't understand
how everything works but and believe me
I understand that there's the elite and
there's the power brokers of the
Republican National Party that want to
put forward their guy but the other
thing is is that the Republican National
Party when it comes down to it they want
to win and there was an article that
came out in didn't come out in the
United States but came out in England in
the UK somebody posted it on the Ron
Paul forums I don't have a link with me
but if you go to romp all forums you'll
find it there I think under the
grassroots topic but in any case there
was an article and this analyst
basically suggested that there were a
lot of rumors right now that the GOP was
looking to drop McCain now the article
did not mention rampal at all it talked
about maybe the GP trying to look for
someone like Colin Powell or Condoleezza
Rice or someone like that which I don't
know how that would work since none of
them have any delegates but
then again maybe you don't need
delegates I don't know but in any case
it just it suggested that the the
Republican Party is beginning to realize
that McCain is behind the polls he's not
competitive against Obama the GOP base
is not excited about McCain
conservatives don't like him which is a
major block of the Republican voters and
the Republican establishment is really
worried and they're looking at possibly
dropping McCain maybe McCain would drop
out citing health reasons now I don't
know if that's true or not but just the
fact that someone's writing about it not
a Ron Paul supporter but actually just a
news commentator out of England that
someone's saying that is pretty
significant and I realized that lately I
you knowed regiment a big deal i think
on friday that the pole between Obama
mccain is now even but i mean up until
this point mccain Obama is that a huge a
huge margin of just victory over mccain
me he just has a lot more people excited
about him and even with the the poll
numbers tied like they are because I
guess Obama's made some gas or whatever
over the last week it still seems that
there's no way McCain can win against
Obama I mean when you have seventy to
eighty percent of the american
population against the war and obama
saying he's against the war mccain says
he's for it there's just no way mccain
can win so so you have you have people
talking about this you have these rumors
going around that the GOP may drop
McCain there was a conference call that
the delegates from Pennsylvania had with
Ron and Carol Paul a couple weeks ago
and they basically asked me I said look
if we can get a majority of delegates
from five states to nominate you from
the from the floor of the convention
will you accept the nomination and Ron
Paul said yes absolutely but it would
have to completely be driven by the
supporters so um so Ron Paul still open
to it there's delegates in Pennsylvania
Ron Paul's home state that are trying to
get things organized as far as we know
Nevada is going to be sending a slate of
Ron Paul delegates
a majority of ron paul delegates to the
convention although that's a little
tricky because there's also going to be
supposedly a republican national or
state convention official state
convention at the end of july that's
also planning to send us late but but
just the fact that there's going to be
two slates battling it out and then the
people in Minneapolis st. Paul are going
to have to figure it out there's going
to be a like a brawl I mean there's
going to be intense conflict going on
and one thing that's article from
England suggested was that the McCain
nomination is not sure they said while
Obama is pretty much the the nominee I
mean he's a shoo-in know Hillary's not
going to challenge him the same thing is
not the case for McCain and there's a
lot up in the air so then the other
thing that I was thinking about is you
know I know that getting into conspiracy
theories doesn't really help or anything
but thing is is that um McCain had like
virtually no support going into the
primaries I mean his campaign was dead
and then all of a sudden he was winning
primary after primary after primary
getting all this huge percentage of the
vote whereas Ron Paul raises millions of
dollars more money than any Republican
candidate out there and yet he gets a
small margin of every primary I mean I'm
sorry they cannot just be explained by
you know older people who don't have the
internet that doesn't make any sense so
I mean it seems to me that the primaries
were obviously rigged the caucuses were
rigged and that Ron Paul probably got a
lot more of the vote then then then was
let on so if the primaries and caucuses
were stolen and there's nothing we can
do about it then it seems like we the
people have an obligation to make sure
that the delegates that are sent to the
convention do all they can to make sure
the people are represented I mean these
delegates are people their average
people like you and me that maybe
they're more politically minded but
their people and they're not part of the
elite and these delegates are the ones
that are voting from the nominee even
the delegates that our pledge to vote
for McCain they don't have to vote for
mccain in the first round they can
abstain and I'm sorry but McCain does
not have an excited base I could
certainly see a McCain pledged or bound
delegate
having second thoughts and possibly
abstaining to turn the convention into a
brokered one and then if the GOP is
looking for a new nominee and so they
sort of drop McCain or they're not
backing as much as they they they should
and they drop him that gives Ron Paul
supporters and opening again to say well
look we got a guy that we know could
beat obama and we know can actually
still obama supporters so there's so
much that seems like says that ron paul
could win the nomination plus even
though I know it's unlikely in terms of
Ron Paul going into this convention with
hardly any delegates and he's not even
been invited but the fact is there is
historical precedent I mean Abraham
Lincoln had fewer delegates than Ron
Paul did and Abraham Lincoln wound up
getting the nomination yes it's unlikely
yes it's only happened I guess maybe
once before maybe twice but all I know
is of Abraham Lincoln but it's still
possible so there's historical precedent
there's rumors that the GP want to drop
McCain we know for a fact that the GOP
base is not excited about McCain and
that the huge money machine behind
bushes terms are not behind the game we
know that Obama is winning in the polls
or is typically winning in the polls and
even when they're tied you're still
saying Obama's get a win so you know
there's a lot out there that suggests
that we Ron Paul supporters have an
opportunity but if we try to go to this
convention if we try to you know and I
definitely i'm encouraging everyone to
go to the rally but go also to the
Republican convention and try to reach
these delegates I love the thing that's
going on with they're trying to get dvds
in the hands of delegates have ron paul
signs try to reach as many delegates as
possible and convince them about ron
paul because then we could win this
thing you really could I myself you know
I'm a public creature and I wanted to go
and actually preach in front of the
convention but I don't know if that's
going to happen because I have not been
able to raise any money yet I had a few
people that said they were going to send
me something but nothing's come in the
mail so i don't think i'll be able to go
to Minneapolis unless I certainly get a
windfall of money but in any case anyone
who can go should really
to make the Republican National
Convention part of their stay there and
in particular trying to focus and center
on the delegates so I just wanted to put
that out there to encourage ron paul
supporters that we shouldn't you know
just automatically think ron paul is not
going to win the nomination because i
think there's still a good chance he
could all right thank you
